Reviews.Title: “5 * at right price”
Reviews.Author: Tony G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last week. The environment and situation makes it very practical due to its location in the Paseo Castellana. The reception, attitude of the employees and service were excellent. The rooms eventhought the one I had was pretty small for a 5* hotel, were well equipped and the bathroom very functional. One of the extraordinary caracteristics of this place was the excellent barman they employ. This french gentlemen (sorry but i do not recall his name)demonstrated a spectacular knowledge and assortment of gins ans well as whiskeys. It s worth discussing with him and asking him to recommend you some astonishing new discoveries.

Reviews.Title: “Central and Cozy!”
Reviews.Author: JoaoMBPinheiro
Reviews.Content: I've been to Madrid for the last 3 years more often, because I study in Spain, and usually I stay here with my family. And I must say that this is a great place to stay. The rooms are spacious, the cleanliness is clear and the staff is nice! The best part of the Hotel is that you get to be in the center of Madrid and you pay an bargain price for the stay while actually enjoying being in the Hotel! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “I loved my stay here!”
Reviews.Author: POlivia
Reviews.Content: I've chosen this hotel because it's close to the Santiago Bernabeu stadium. You can walk the distance with no problems. It's close to the metro and you'll quickly find yourself in the center of the town. The internet works like a charm! We've had the breakfast included in the room price and it was a delight. The staff is proffesional and welcoming at the same time!

Reviews.Title: “Small luxury with great service”
Reviews.Author: aphillips61
Reviews.Content: We just spent a few days on vacation in Madrid and decided to stay at NH's small luxury hotel on the Castellana Avenue. The Hesperia greats you right off the plane with a glass of Cava (Spanish version of Champagne) and a smile. The location is perfect, just a few minutes walk to Serrano, the famous shopping district, not further away from downtown and the museum district and if you want to do some shopping two blocks away from the Corte Ingles. Our rooms were perfect, we had what they call a family suite, a junior plus a normal room with two beds, breakfast is a very nice spread of goodies and the service is really excellent! We were definitely not disappointed and if I have the opportunity to go back soon I will definitely stay at the Hesperia Madrid once again. You just cannot go wrong

Reviews.Title: “Sanclaire Hotel Critic's review”
Reviews.Author: Sanclaire007
Reviews.Content: It is in a good commuting location. The rooms are very comfortable and service is impressive. We were looked after very well. We had the honor of having being served in the chef's table in the Michelin starred restaurant which is one of the life time experiences. Our booking included the breakfast which was highlight of our stay. Starting every day of our stay with great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with a fantastic gym”
Reviews.Author: PvLAchterveld
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, great breakfast, and a superb roof top gym!

Reviews.Title: “An American in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: stacey s
Reviews.Content: This is my 6th visit to Madrid and my fourth hotel. If you have not been to Madrid before and do not have a command of Spanish then this is a great hotel for you. It, like many so called 5 start Madrid hotels, have plenty of staff, including the waiters, that have a command of English. Indeed, the music is all American rock. Converselyy, if you want a true Spanish experience in your hotel then perhaps this is not the one for you. The location on the Paseo de Castellana is very good, though not as good as the Westin Palace whcih is near the Prado and Plaza Mayor, but it is near many other museums and if traveling for business it is much closeer to the business center (5 minute cab ride). It is a 7-8 minute cab ride to the nicest shopping areaa or you can get there if you like a bit of a longr walk, but it is walkable. The lobby is nice and the hotel does sport a two Michelin star restaurant (Santceloni). We found the food to be quite good and the hotel seems to put a lot of efffort into its cusine. The staff is very friendly and accomodating and they seem to truly appreciate your business. The most importnat aspect of a hotel is its rooms. We were in room 407, a junior suite. The suite has a king size bed and another room with two twin beds. There was plenty of room, though the closet space is sparse and does not have enough hangers, which annoyed my wife. There were some other nice luxuries like robes, slippers and other amenities like lotions and soaps. The bathroom itself is not large, but sufficient. The room was very clean and the bed comfortable, but trending towards the harder side from a mattress perspective. There is a turn down service as well. There is a small desk that is large enough for most people. My biggest complaint is the internet. The service is free, however, if you do not use it for a few minutes you have to sign in again. In a given day I must have signed in 10-15 times which is just stupid. I was here for a conference and the meeting facilities were also nice and the food served was surprisingly good. Temperature control was a bit of a problem, but only in a minor way. Pricing is not too bad commpared to similar hotels and is significanlty better than the Palace Hotel (Westin). Overall, a very nice stay with a little bit of luxury. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: London_Travellers_09
Reviews.Content: The hotel has great breakfast and though it is 24 euros it is value for money. Staff are friendly and a credit to the brand. Room was a disappointment - it had a view of a wall 2 or 3 metres away and was dark. But it was quite quiet. Location worked for me as I was staying for business and close to where I needed to be. The room service was very good - sushi - and speedy. No iron in the room was main disadvantage for me - the pressing service was far too expensive for the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel...”
Reviews.Author: A D
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice and quaint... It won't be around much longer as they are converting the hotel into condos... Overall, good service and staff is friendly. Most staff is bilingual in English and Spanish... I had no problem communicating with the staff as I speak both languages. Only issue is that the hotel is quite far from the heart of the city, but it is close to the US Embassy.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: isabel a
Reviews.Content: Well situated in one of the most upscale part of Madrid ,part of the LHW,this hotel is a very good choice.As i said the location is perfect, the rooms are not very big but are well decorated,with a very confortable bed and plasma tv and all the necessary aminities,being the toilatries of very good quality. Service is very good at the front desk ,with helpful staff,speaking reasonable english. Concierge is also good in reccommendations but difficult to find ( most of the time there is nobody at the concierge desk) . Breakfast is exccellent, although some of the waiters are not in a very good mood most of the times,but the variety and the quality of the food is really superb. The bar is ok. Price is very reasonable. It is really a good choice in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Very convinient location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Redsan B
Reviews.Content: Getting there from the airport was easy, I took the subway and the station is right around the corner, some 20 metres. Once in the hotel, staff helped with my bags, and I was greeted in perfect English. I was given a room after they checked my preferences with me, very nice and clean room, very quiet as I wanted to have a good rest before my meetings the day after. Breakfast was great and the overall experience could not be any better, I will for sure be coming back the Hesperia. One thing I noticed for sure is that the staff is the most friendly I have seen out there, and I travel quite a lot, but had never met such a team.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ed_Mississauga
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I ever stayed. A 5-stars hotel. The service is impeccable, breakfast is great, rooms are clean and dustless. The bed is a queen size bed with a down blanket. These days, most 4-stars hotels look clean but are dusty (I am allergic to dust). I have been to 4-stars (and above) hotels in recent years, but this is the only one that I feel really dust-free. I have not tried its restuarants, and one is Michelin-awarded restaurant and they should be good. However, this hotel is not perfect. It locates in a quiet exclusive residential area, about 10-15 minutes drive to downtown, and do not have much to see around the hotel. A subway station is not far away and taking a taxi is quite convenient. The bed is not as comfy as a 4-start hotel I stayed in this trip. As a 5-stars hotel, they should have a comfy king or king plus bed. Also, the shower is an old fashion shower with a bathtub. But all in all, an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Impecable service, excellent accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Sariano
Reviews.Content: Very well located on Paseo de la Castellana, the Hesperia offers great service and nicely appointed rooms. It also hosts one of the best restaurants in Madrid, the Santceloni. Very convenient to a Metro Station.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice luxury hotel in beautiful location in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: lrlz17
Reviews.Content: The room was beautifully decorated although small. Beds are very comfortable - thick soft mattresses with plump duvets. Breakfast was great - they serve you coffee and orange juice at your table - they keep refilling your cups as you drink - being served was a rarity in Spain. It has a great location and I would highly recommend staying here. You won't be sorry. However, the air conditioning is as elsewhere in Spain - 2 cycles, winter and summer. We were there the last few days of March and they were still on winter - thus all it did was blow warm air but you will find this at most hotels in Spain. Service was excellent - they bend over backwards to serve your needs. Location was great on Paseo de la Castellana - one of the most beautiful boulevards in Madrid and there is a Metro station right around the corner. Across the street there was a Starbucks and a Rodillo (inexpensive sandwich shop). Would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: The rooms are quite welcoming and ensure a good rest overall, the staff was readily available and willing to help. We got most of the information we needed and the reception staff helped arrange for a wonderful dinner reservation. The decor in their new rooms is wonderful. Though the hotel was fully booked, we were upgraded to a premium deluxe room. It was our fist time in Madrid and I should say this was the most exciting stay I have ever had in any hotel out there and will definitely come back and recommend a stay here when you are in Madrid, especially for the staff. Breakfast is a must and make sure you ask for some suggestions on what to do and where to go at the reception or the guest relations, you will not be disappointed. Easy access to town and to the airport, the sky gym has the basic equipment your may require to get over a jet lag and the views from up there are wonderful especially during the evening. This is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The breakfast gave a better impression second time around, but..”
Reviews.Author: FoodWineHols
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a second time whilst on another business trip (not really up to me where I stay). All my previous points stand, i.e. I had another internal-facing room (despite requesting not to) which felt very dark and in my opinion is not up to 5* standards, and I would not recommend the location if you are a tourist visiting Madrid. This time, I also found three (shall we say) *hairs* in the bathroom before I'd even used it, which isn't really pleasant. The one up-side of my stay on this occasion was the breakfast which, for some reason was included this time around but wasn't last. The spread is excellent - everything you can think of, including sushi! They also have a pianist playing, which is a very nice way to start the day. I have no idea how much the breakfast is so cannot say if it is worth it, but seeing as I'm not paying, it was very enjoyable! It's not a big enough pull to stay here if I came to Madrid on holiday though - I'm doing so in May and am booked into a hotel much more centrally located. I'd actually grade the hotel 'good' rather than 'average', but the TA gradings jump from 'average' to 'very good', which it certainly isn't.

Reviews.Title: “3* michelin breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Miguel2770
Reviews.Content: Hesperia Madrid is a very good 5* hotel in Madrid. Service is competent, rooms are small but confortable with everything a 5* should offer, gym is on the top with a great view over the Castellana, and breakfast is incredible good. This is a good option to stay in Madrid if location is not a priority (walking distance). There is a metro station around the corner, and taxi from city center will cost between 8-10 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, far from touristic places but there is a subway beside the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RNVR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not close to touristic center, as Plaza Mayor or Del Sol, but it is close to the most fashionable street, Calle Serrano, with the most expensive stores, bars and restaurants. There is a subway station next to the hotel and that makes everything easier. But wherever we go it is worth to stay at this hotel. The reception is very good, there was always someone by the door to help us with bags, cabs, directions, etc. The concierge was fantastic. They knew all the restaurants, bars and places we could request and quickly they got all the reservations and directions. The check in was fast and easy, although they charged an extra for a bed we wouldn’t even use. The lobby and all social areas were very elegant and charming. The room was nice, with clean walls, curtains and furniture, but nothing surprising about décor. The surprises were on details like the Nespresso machine (although the four capsules were never replaced) and the elegant glasses for wine or whiskey. We stayed in a suite and there was a strange fact: the TV was completely installed at the right side of the room so the one who sleeps at the left side could not watch TV. The bathroom was not spacious but the shower was fine, the towels, slippers and robes were good and the cosmetics line was extensive and wonderful, most of them by Bulgari. The wi fi internet was very fast and reliable. The breakfast was amazing, beginning with cava, the Spanish champagne and finishing with Nespresso, including a great variety of breads, cheeses, jamon, fruits, cereals and hot dishes. That was the best breakfast I had in this trip to Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Room to small and service to slow”
Reviews.Author: Jacob_Nu
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks nice, in a old building. That is ok but when we came in it took about 1 hour to check in. Not enough personel and there was only 1 guy who was very slow on the computer. This was already anoying. When I came to the room it did not open. I had to get assigned a different room and also that took 10 minutes or so. The room was cold, the bathroom even colder. The room was very small and had nearly no navigation space. For the rest it was ok. We decided to take breakfast some where else and leave a soon as possible in the morning. Checking out was very fast. So that is positive,

Reviews.Title: “Quite Good”
Reviews.Author: Luxury47
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for two nights on a business trip. Like most other reviewers I found the hotel staff to be very friendly. I loved the breakfast buffet. The lunch in the same restaurant was also quite good. I highly recommend their Michelin starred restaurant, Santceloni. The rooms are good but not great. Also I recommend to ask for the street facing rooms. My first room faced a wall and I asked to upgrade to a street facing room which costs EUR 40 more but was worth it for me. The hotel has free wi-fi. But logging in is very annoying. They give you a code which is not related to one's last name/room number. Every time you are logged out you have to type in this number.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: cesartapia
Reviews.Content: Since the moment we arrived we had great service at front desk. The staff is helpful and friendly, willing to serve you anytime at your request. We were a family of six, located in two triple rooms with enough space to move along. Definitively will be another stay in the future. Beautiful surroundings in Paseo La Castellana at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location--unbelievably helpful staff in a crisis”
Reviews.Author: Hiddendune
Reviews.Content: My wallet and passport on route hotel (metro pickpocket --beware) and I arrived with no ID or money. They helped me get to US Embassy ( very closeby), took my bags, helped ith Police report, payment method,etc, etc....they could not have done more. Room was great;hotel and all connections were nearby. Only negative is that breakfast is very overpriced and there are small cafe or Starbucks across the street

Reviews.Title: “Great place slightly away from the center”
Reviews.Author: LoraTraveling
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice, has special atmosphere, food is good, services and meeting rooms are also quite good. The gym is on the top floor but don't expect spectacular view. The only issue is that is is not too central but is in a good area and the taxi to old city and restaurants/bars is 10euro or so.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and helpful staff, just a few things to improve”
Reviews.Author: Thongchai4286
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 5 nights here on our honeymoon and we had a great time. We were upgraded on arrival because of LHW membership and the staff were great! Room was comfortable and we had a nice view. Only thing that could improve was the food. We had amazing room service the first night and when we ate in the Scotch bar it was great, however a few times the room service was poor, must have been a different chef because we ordered the same thing and got half the amount and not well cooked etc. the sushi from the sushi bar was really good. But all in all the food was a little overpriced. Apart from that though an excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SPatel63
Reviews.Content: Staff is attentive and the hotel is ideally located with the Barrio Salamanca for high end shops withing walking distance as well as the museum - Prado. Internet connection although free is a bit finnicky as it logs you out quite quickly if you are not on it for a few minutes. Newspaper delivered to the room carries a surcharge and there is no clock in the room (a standard in most hotels these days). Also a bit run down therefore, I cannot justify the 5 stars that this hotel claims

Reviews.Title: “They really jam the discount traveler”
Reviews.Author: atourist00
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal on Priceline, but of course the staff knows this. Try tried to "upgrade" me immediately to a suite for another EUR99 a day, but when I declined I got one of those crappy, tiny rooms facing the wall. Also, how is it possible the temperature control is so bad? It was only 60 degrees outside in Madrid but the heat was awful and too high, and of course when you tried to cool down the room using the A/C it did not work. (Opening the window was the only alternative, but because these rooms face the wall you get little ventilation). Overall it was okay, but just because you got a "deal" on Priceline doesn't mean you'll get a "deal!" Otherwise hotel was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with some minor flaws”
Reviews.Author: BastiAina
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located In the ideal spot for visting Madrid--good access to the airport, subway right next door, close to the old part of town, near Barrio Salamanca for high end shops and walking distance to Madrid's famed museums. The service staff are attentive and the gym is divine with views most people in Madrid can only dream of. The amenities like towels, pillows, toiletries are top class. The room we got, though, was really small and faced a wall. I was shocked when told that they charge 3 euro to bring a newspaper up to the room each day. 5 star and you charge for something like this? Wow. The room has no iron, which is really useful if you dont want to pay for a hotel pressing service. Also room had no clock, another useful amenity when you have jetlag. The internet wifi access, while free, logs off after three minutes of inactivity. A bit of a hassle. Would I stay again? Yes because of the location and gym. But please, bring us the paper for free.

Reviews.Title: “A bit run down for a 5 star hotel. Excellent gym with great views of Madrid's skyline”
Reviews.Author: Acalpixca
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with a steep internet discount and maybe that's why we were given a small room with a window facing a wall! The condition of some areas (carpet, etc.) needs a bit of work. Service was very good. We didn't try the restaurant or even breakfast (it's better to go to any of Madrid's cafés for a traditional chocolate con churros breakfast - that's hot thick chocolate with s doughnut-like pastries). The best part of the hotel is the sky gym, where you can exercise while enjoying fantastic views of Madrid's skyline.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but not quite 5*”
Reviews.Author: FoodWineHols
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week whilst working in Madrid. It felt very much a business hotel, and I wouldn't stay here if I was visiting Madrid as a tourist. It is a metro or bus ride to the centre, and there isn't much in the surrounding area that is typical of Madrid (I know Madrid well having lived there and visited several times). The lobby is very grand, but the room I was allocated didn't live up to a 5* room in my opinion. I had read on here about the rooms which face internally, so there is no sunlight, and unfortunately I got one of these. It was however a good size, and the bathroom was as big as the bedroom. I opened the bathroom window on arrival, and it opened out onto the nextdoor room's private terrace. It also didn't close properly and I was slightly concerned about safety as someone could easily climb in. I suggested changing rooms but this wasn't really addressed and somebody came to fix the window. The sunlight was not too much of an issue because I was out all day every day, but it wouldn't have been pleasant otherwise and in my opinion that's not a 5* room - it was constantly dark. The bathroom, whilst big, was also not 5* - more like 4*, it felt a bit dated. Overall, the stay was fine. I didn't have much engagement with the staff - I didn't eat at the hotel, didn't use the gym and I literally just came back to sleep. With regards to the environs - I had a walk around the block to find the best of something remotely Spanish that I could! There are a couple of tapas bars if you make the effort to walk around, and Bar Krefky (I think) opposite the hotel next to Starbucks was quite pleasant for lunch - full of locals at least. Turn right out of the hotel and keep walking, there are a couple of bars there, or turn right then first right up that road and there is one there. If you come to Madrid to see the sights and soak up the atmosphere, I wouldn't recommend this place; if you come to Madrid for business, this is fine but there are probably better 5* options around.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: 333Julie
Reviews.Content: Good value for a late deal. Well kept hotel. Felt quite business like.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Viajerosin
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at Hesperia Hotel on our way back home. It's a beautiful hotel located in the Salamanca district. It's not close to the main touristic attractions but it is very easy to get around by metro or taxi. We stayed at the Family suite, it was very comfortable and clean. The toiletries in the bathroom were great. The bed was so comfortable, we wished we could have had more time to stay longer. The windows were sound proof. They have an extensive breakfast buffet, overpriced but good.

Reviews.Title: “Still same good quality”
Reviews.Author: gringottsgoblin
Reviews.Content: This is the second time in the Hesperia, and again it has maintained a good standard. The food and service is friendly efficient and of a high standard. It has a good location and very convenient for the metro which is a big plus to get to the centre and the airport. I like the hotel and it has a good atmosphere. My only criticism realy is on the rooms. I had one on the inner courtyard. Avoid these, while they are quiet they are very dark and their sombreness is a little depressing, and the room a little small though conversely the bathroom is very generous. I like the hotel, but my advice is be picky about the room that you accept.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gooders-McDog
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times on business and would like to say what a lovely hotel it is. The rooms are large and clean and the food is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “More a business stay than a leisure one”
Reviews.Author: Peshak
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine. Service was a little abrupt. Limited ambience. Completely fine for a business stay, but not for a leisure trip to Madrid. Located a little too far away from the centre.

Reviews.Title: “I really loved this Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bird1010
Reviews.Content: This is in a fabulous neighborhood. It is a 5euro taxi to Prado/ Reina. The staff is warm and professional. The breakfast is literally the best I have ever had ($$$). The value is excellent. Do not forget to bring exercise clothes as the facilities on the top floor are the coolest I have ever experienced. Great concierge, do not miss the market with the fabulous wine tastings and "bars" as well as lots of "ready to eat" snacks and meals.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent breakfast - great stay”
Reviews.Author: Bosnich
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hesperia in Madrid for a weekend with my brother for his 30th birhtday and we had a great time. Some points on the hotel: + The breakfast is excellent, best I have ever seen in a hotel, staff continuously refill glasses with fresh orange juice, vast amount of choice on the buffet + The hotel is right next to a subway stop that takes you right into the city center and busses to the museums leave right outside the hotel + We also had a great and inexpensive three course lunch at the hotel restaurant on a Friday - very recommendable (-) The room was a little small for a superior room and wasn`t ready when we arrived, but as we did not spend much time in it that did not really bother us (-) There is no Spa, but again that did not bother us a lot - there is a small Gym on the top floor though. Tipp: The hotel is a member of the Leading Hotels of the World. If you become a member of their Leaders Club (it costs a 100 USD p.a.) you get free upgrade, free wifi and free breakfast for two, which ususally pays off if two people stay for more than two nights plus you get the same benefits at any other LHW in the world.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice for Madrid”
Reviews.Author: TruTravelor
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and enjoyed it. The hotel is in a quieter part of Madrid, but within a minute, you can be at a bus station where you can catch a quick bus into the heart of the city and the attractions. The room was nice and the beds were comfortable. There were three of us, so they had to add a cot and we still had enough room. We did have an exterior room, so I would request one after having read some of the other reviews. The hotel staff was great and they gave us free drinks while we waited for our room to be ready. There is a mini bar (which I used as a frig), and free internet service. Breakfast was not included, but there is a Starbucks and a sandwich place right across the street if you prefer. There is also a VIPs within walking distance. All in all, I had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not a five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Magnus2009
Reviews.Content: The most accurate review I read was from the person who said they really wanted to like the place but couldn't. If one is expecting a five star hotel room, they will be very disappointed. The rooms are tiny and the decor is pretty average. We had an inside room that faced an ugly group of walls. This presented a situation where you couldn't really tell whether it was day or night. Although the room has a system wherein you have to insert your room key in a slot to allow electricity to work, we learned to NOT have our room cleaned rather than risk having the cleaning staff take the extra ket out. While I understand the concept of conversation, Madrid is brutally hot in the summer. Without leaving the air on during the day, the room becomes an inferno. Given the darkness and self-created cool condition, I feel like we slpt most of our days in Madrid away. Of course that may have been because people stay out partying until morning anyway. If I go back to Madrid, it definitely would not be in the summer and I would stay elsewhere closer to the sights, resteraunts, shopping, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of interior rooms”
Reviews.Author: snyc123
Reviews.Content: All in all, Hesperia Madrid was a great hotel in a location that worked out very well for our needs. We booked for three days and got a wonderful rate that included breakfast. When we got there, we saw that our room was going to be an interior one, which was quite dark, facing a wall. We upgraded to a room with a view of Paseo Castellana for 50 more euros per night! So much for the great deal! We thought the room was nicely furnished and appreciated how quiet it was, The buffet breakfast is bountiful!

Reviews.Title: “Very swank hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: aitenshi
Reviews.Content: POSITIVES: Very clean and has good lighting Spacious room with comfortable bed and pillows Nice bathroom with many toiletries including bathrobes and slippers. Delicious buffet breakfast with a good variety of food and attentive waitstaff. There is a bus stop and subway station less than 2 minutes walk from the hotel that can take you to Puerta del sol, Palacio Real and Plaza Mayor. Lots of restaurants and tapas bar nearby. Many ATMs round the corner from the hotel eg. Barclays NEGATIVES: Room key has to be used in the lift in order to operate it. Thus its easy to forget and leave room key in the lift.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant staff, good choice while in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Flightpro
Reviews.Content: The Hesperia Madrid is not that big but friendly hotel. The moment you enter the front doors you are in a quite haven. Check in staff are polite and the rooms are well maintained. Just exactly what you need for a weekend break in the Spanish capitol. As mentioned earlier in other reviews the hotel is just a few steps away from the metro station. Within 10-20 minutes you can travel to all the hot spots, even the airport is with a single stop reachable (which saves you a lot of taxi expenses). Busses do also stop just a couple of meters from the hotel and they drive even after midnight. This is Spain, where people like to go out to the streets for food and drinks not earlier than 10-11pm. While in Madrid we used travel cards for the metro and busses. For 3 days we only had to pay 13 euro. A steal compared to other countries (Eg. in my hometown Amsterdam the price for a single ticket costs 2,60 euro). Across the street is a pleasant Starbucks, a good place to start the day with coffee and their usual cookie and pie assortment. A little walk will bring you to the Calle de Serano, Madrid's version of 5th Avenue. For good food please do try the San Miguel Market in the Old Town (metro stop Opera). There you will find nice tapas, lovely wines, paella, steaks, ice cream, cakes, etc... The things I really missed at the Hesperia hotel were a pool (would loved to use it when temperatures rose to almost 40 degrees during our stay) and coffee and tea making facilities in the room. But that is something that a lot of 5 star hotel all over the world are not offering. On the other hand the free wifi was a nice bonus, however do not forget to ask the receptionists for multiple entry codes. You will need seperate codes for each device (Ipad, phone, laptop).

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: felicityineurope
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights for work. I really liked this hotel and would stay here again without hesitation. Positives: - Lovely staff - Quiet room with heavy block out blinds which make the room very dark - Comfortable bed - Very nice bathroom and toiletries - Free fast wifi - Incredible breakfast spread (wish I could have stayed all day) - Metro stop 10 metres away Negatives: - Not all that much directly around hotel, although admittedly I didn’t have much time to explore - It’s quite a walk from the Old Town although I prefer the Salamanca area anyway and you could catch the metro in no time - If not included in rooms rate breakfast is expensive (EUR30 if you just turn up or EUR23 if you book at check in) - No outdoor area for lounging in the sunshine

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good restaurants rooms vary”
Reviews.Author: Xymyz
Reviews.Content: This is one of the better hotels for business travellers to Madrid. The quality of rooms can vary. On my first visit I got a sinle room that was very ackward shape on a low floor facing the road. This one I didnt enjoy so beware if you are given room on the first floor. Second visit was better but my room on the 4th floor was dark. Free wifi is great. If you like airy space Hilton at the Madrid airport is better. The restaurants in the hotel are worth a try. I enjoyed both the Japanese restaurant and the bar food.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed staying there. Will be back.”
Reviews.Author: travelpro_d
Reviews.Content: Very good 4*+ hotel. Breakfast is excellent with big variety of options and friendly/attentive service. Metro and bus station 100m away. Easy access to all places of Madrid. Business as well as individual tourists as guests.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel , excellent buffet breakfast .”
Reviews.Author: sheila_poli_peer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hesperia 4 nights, it ain't our first time in Madrid . This hotel had an excellent deal with a late departure and breakfast included. Staff was incredible and we enjoyed very much.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and nothing special don't waste your money!”
Reviews.Author: anngermaine
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst hotel I have ever stayed in! The rooms were very old fashioned and the general decor of the hotel is shabby.the breakfast is horrible and way over priced.the portions are tiny and not enough for everyone.had to wait for ages to get a table.dining room too small for amount of guests.not impressed at all would never go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and room, but mediocore wifi”
Reviews.Author: nomerlot
Reviews.Content: Just completed four nights at this very comfortable business hotel. Received an upgrade at check-in and excellent service, especially from the consierge team. Only downside was the Wifi in my room stopped working on Saturday morning (after the corporate clients left on Friday) and came back full force on Monday (after the corporate clients started returning). I was given a free pass to use the computers in the hotel's business center, which was good but not the same as operating my own computer in my room. Also, the location is excellent: 10 minutes away by metro from the noisy and congested city center, and with a metro stop on the corner nearest to the Hesperia. That's my report to you.

Reviews.Title: “Either run by scammers or unwilling to admit when they've made a mistake”
Reviews.Author: screenname80
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, the person at the front desk clearly told us that breakfast was included in our stay, free of charge. Multiple people in my party heard this, and since it was unexpected, we double-checked to verify that it really was free. We were told "yes". A week goes by while we enjoy our breakfast. When it's time to leave, we learn that there's an extra charge of over 300 USD for breakfast! 27 euros (about 37 USD) each breakfast! We were upset about this, but we figured it was a mistake since we were so clearly told that our meals would be included free of charge in our stay. We spoke to multiple people, including two different "Guest Relations Managers". No one would listen to us. Eventually after lots of time spent arguing when we could have been enjoying our vacation, they discounted the charge. But a discounted rip off is still a rip off. We felt cheated and lied to. This ruined the entire experience, the way a bad ending to a movie ruins an entire movie. Later, I tried to dispute the charge on my credit card, but the credit card company sided with the hotel. Maybe the breakfast wasn't supposed to be included. But that's not the point. We were clearly told it was. So either Hesperia had intentionally scammed us, or they were simply unwilling to admit when they'd made a mistake. Either way, it's simply not worth staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: julphil
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, clean modern rooms and common areas. On main street but very quiet. A 15 minute walk to Prado museum and another 30 minute walk to main centre. However buses and metro available

Reviews.Title: “Nice, But Not Five Star”
Reviews.Author: tsogl
Reviews.Content: The Hesperia Madrid is generally nice, but is not a five star hotel in my view. This is probably the nicest of the four hotels where we have stayed in Madrid. Our room was nice, and the bathroom was generally okay. The breakfast buffet was generally good. Internet access was variable and was not always reliable.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: spyce
Reviews.Content: we were twice in madrid, the first time we styaed at gran melia fenix and in our last time at the hesperia madrid.. we love the hotel!!the room great the bathroom had bvlgary amenities.. the staff great the berakfast super!!yes i would defently be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Not A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: egp173
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because of the rating and because it was not a HUGE hotel. The hotel was nice, the room very large by European standards and the bathroom huge. It seemed to have mostly business people and although the area is nice, it is at least a cab, train or bus ride away from any points of interest in Madrid. The restaurant was very good (actually the very best food we had in Madrid). All in all, if you don't mind traveling a bit to sightsee, or you are in Madrid on business, this is a fine hotel. If you are here to sightsee, you might want to stay somewhere closer to Central Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Mmmmmm..... not sure”
Reviews.Author: holidaymaker186342
Reviews.Content: On the plus side - fabulous Spanish breakfast and really attentive staff. Downside - the room. We arrived on a spring afternoon and were given a (booked) standard room on the 4th floor. The room was stiflingly hot and really dark as the window opened out onto a brick wall (the courtyard?). Really disappointed. Rang down to reception to change the room, and were told that we could only be moved into another room at a cost of 80 euros per night. OK, not gonna do that. After the first night we felt so ill & dehydrated we told reception that the room was unacceptably hot, and they moved us to a room with a "better aspect with more air". Much better. Girls - weird assortment of toiletries (I'm cabin crew and have never come across a 4*+ hotel that doesn't provide shampoo & conditioner - even raided the cleaner's trolley - nothing. Plenty of shaving and shoe cleaning stuff! The hotel is a bit too far to walk into the city centre and is predominately a business hotel, but on the whole OK.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay in Hesperia”
Reviews.Author: TrioCA
Reviews.Content: We have stayed for 5 days in the hotel. It was a very good experience. The front desk staff (especially Haginson ) was very patient and friendly, gave us a lot of information, tips. We asked a lot of questions about subways, trains, taxis and about day trips to Toledo and Segovia. They gave us all the info we asked, including pulling up train schedules on the computer for us. Bellmen were also very friendly with my daughter, teaching her spanish etc. Front desk manager Reyes was very flexible in addressing our needs with room etc. We had a very good experience and will recommend to all of our friends in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational”
Reviews.Author: lilainmelb
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel for a bit of 5 star luxury at the end of our trip. Everything was fantastic! The rooms were a good size, clean and comfortable. The staff were all extremely friendly, with great advice of places to visit. They all spoke perfect English, which was great given my poor Spanish. The buffet breakfast was amazing - a great selection and shouldn't be missed! The only down side is that the hotel isn't within an easy walking distance from the main tourist sites, but it's a very quick taxi ride or an easy train trip, so I wouldn't let that put you off!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect experience”
Reviews.Author: umangc
Reviews.Content: The hotel was among the better 5-stars i've stayed at. We got upgraded upon check-in, there were complimentary gifts along the way, and the staff (especially Paula Santos) went out of their way to ensure our whole stay in Madrid was perfect - great recommendations for restaurants, performances, bars, etc., with them working the phones to get us the appropriate reservations. Breakfast was a treat both days that we were there. Bottomline: i've rarely been treated as well at any other hotel worlwide.

Reviews.Title: “noise a problem”
Reviews.Author: brooksie22
Reviews.Content: The walls were paper thin - I never have trouble sleeping in hotels as I spend most of the week in them but there was so much noise that I couldn't sleep. Nice hotel. Good food but if its sleep you're after take a pill!

Reviews.Title: “A quiet place in a lively city”
Reviews.Author: B-Belgian
Reviews.Content: Great hotel : friendly reception, clean & large rooms, choice of restaurants ( incl michelin star with one of the restaurants ), ... Negative point is you are not on walking distance of city centre ( only to Bernabeu and El Corte Ingles ). Definitely place to go back to when next time in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable weekend”
Reviews.Author: RobertPEEL
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel for a bit of 5 star luxury at a reasonable price. Everything was excellent. When I booked, the offer was two fold. One, a late check out, 5pm, and on the first day, a free minibar. However these, apparantly, were missing from their booking confirmation. After a further discussion they agreed the late check out but would not accept the minibar offer. When I reurned to the UK, I called up the site and I was right. So, double check these so called offers. These could possibly be a rue to entice one to book, and then blame the booking company when there is a dispute. This did not ruin the weekend and the staff were extremely helpful. Madrid is definately a place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Truly one of the Leading Hotels of the World”
Reviews.Author: Trevordg
Reviews.Content: What can I say, the Hotel Hesperia Madrid must be the best Hotel I have ever stayed in. Commencing with the room, it was enormous with a very comfortable bathroom, as well as a large bedroom. The rooms were cleaned twice a day and fresh towels were always provided for. The Hotel also has a free wi-fi service accessible all over the hotel. I also made use of the Gym which although not the largest is still quite comfortable to get a good workout. Furthermore, the breakfast was always abundant with varied choices, both for the health conscious and those who don't mind adding a few extra inches! I was staying at the Hesperia for a conference and the food served throughout was always very good. I would have loved to try the restaurants at the Hotel however they were closed on Monday night. one last comment about the location. Whilst the Hotel is not centrally located the Taxis in Madrid are not that expensive and one can reach the center in a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Good”
Reviews.Author: JulesandSand
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in a Junior Suite (404) which was very nice indeed, apart from a silly shower over the bath - really not acceptable in a 5 star hotel these days. We found the staff polite and helpful if a little impersonal. We didn't breakfast here as 50 Euros for 2 is just ridiculous, the room service prices were equally OTT. We seemed to be the only 'tourists' staying at the time as every other guest were wearing business suits. Perhaps the prices reflect the fact that many guests will be on expenses! The Madrid metro is excellent for getting around the city and there is a station about 50m from the hotel. There is a very well equipped gym on the top floor. I can't comment on the restaurants as we didn't eat in any of them. All in all perfectly acceptable but were I to return to Madrid I would probably try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michbain
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy my stay at this hotel, nice, ellegant, excellente service, my only complaint and is because my husband´s back problem, is that the bed is like a feather pillow and that is so bad for people with back problems, that was the only issue.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've ever stayed...”
Reviews.Author: Smackola
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. Clean. Helpful staff. Had a drink and cigar in the cigar lounge, great selection of cigars and a really helpful staff working in the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: pg0909
Reviews.Content: It's the best hotel i stayed in Spain.Excellent location ,excellent service and best price Only difficult to find parking if you have car

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, fair price and great staff”
Reviews.Author: travelinfools
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the hotel and staff. Prices a little steep in the lounge area but you did not have to drink there. The subway connection is less than half a block. Starbucks across the street along with a little cafeteria. Rooms immaculate. The only thing I would add is a coffee maker and ice bucket for the room. What can I say, I am an American:)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during the World Cup. Needless to say that we had a great experience in Madrid. However, our luggage was lost for 3 days. The staff was incredibly kind and helpful (even let us make an international call from the lobby). The hotel has a small hotel feel even though it's really not that small. Adorable and modern lobby with a cute bar. The rooms and bed were very comfortable. The rooms are not huge (most European hotel rooms are not very big) but still comfortable. The only two problems with the hotel is the distance from the city center and the water temperature. There is a metro nearby so the distance was not too big of a problem (except for the night of world cup where you could not get a cab if your life depended on it.....but who cares at that point). Taxi is a few euro and the metro is super cheap. The water pressure was fine but would sometimes mysteriously turn hot or cold for a minute (without being touched). That was a little annoying. They did provide nice little touches like turn down service, bathrobes, and great bath supplies (everything from a comb and shaving kit to a toothbrush but not conditioner so bring that along). The maids were also very good (didn't once call to see if we were finally getting out of our room at 4 pm so that they can clean the room). Very clean hotel and didn't hear any noise at all during the night. Great beds too and free internet. Overall, I would definitely stay at this hotel again (it's also a great value for what you are getting - we paid a little over a 100 euro a night).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Pintxos
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through an offer and were very happy with it. It was a little far from the main 'tourist' sites (though close-ish to the Bernabeu Stadium) but there is a metro station and a bank of bus stops right outside. We arrived over the Easter week, and it was pretty quiet, both guests and staff. We were offered a glass of cava on arrival, and the reception staff were very helpful providing us with maps and advice. However the bar was a little quiet the one evening we went, and the barman kept disappearing. The room was very nice, though the bathroom was a little worn looking and we had a few problems with the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: BigTaps
Reviews.Content: Perfectly acceptable hotel, close to the business district and metro but miles from Atocha station. Rooms were fine, good air-con as it was 39 deg c outside. Front office staff were a bit unfriendly and had to be pushed a bit for information. Otherwise, not bad value for 1 nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mackq
Reviews.Content: Would rate more like a 4 star rather than 5 star. Staff were nice and helpful. Room was nice but a little on the small side. OUt a little from the centre of the city but Metro just outside the hotel . Starbucks right across the street for great coffee.

Reviews.Title: “What a terrific find in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Happy_on_the_road
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice before and after a visit to Egypt. First, we spent 2 nights in Room 605 and right now I am in room 305 (which faces Paseo de la Castellana and has a completely different set up) for 4 nights.) Great location, just as good as the Villa Magna at a low price. 3 star Michelin restaurant in the hotel, terrific staff and service, very comfortable rooms, we are thrilled. I am so happy with this choice and am enjoying their free Internet access now. Fantastic breakfasts as well.

Reviews.Title: “Even though not center city, close to Metro and clean, good service”
Reviews.Author: Jennie40
Reviews.Content: 2 mins walk to Metro and close to good shops. Excellent service and beautiful rooms. My husband and I stayed here for a conference and I was a little afraid the location would be out of the way but it's so close to the Metro it didn't matter. One street away from pretty good resaurants if you don't feel like going into town.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable and Clean”
Reviews.Author: familytraveler45
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The staff was very accommodating and very friendly. The concierge was very helpful with making reservations and giving us very good advice as to where to go and where to stay away from. I would stay here again. If you want to be near the Prado Museum then this hotel is a little walk/bus ride away. It was 1Euro on the bus and easy to use. The hotel also has one of the best restaurants in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Nickkenn
Reviews.Content: We were spending time with a friend who lived in Madrid so location was main priority. This hotel was a 5 min walk. Booked through last minute for a suite with an adjoining room. It was about £800 for 3 nights which is enough money. When we arrived we were not disappointed. Our suite was a good size and the adjoining room for the kids was perfect. We booked a 'family package' which was supposed to include a Nintendo Wii and movies and popcorn. This was not promoted and clearly not available but we were busy and to be honest the kids have plenty of that stuff at home so I didn't press the point. Late check in was also promised 5pm on a Monday but when we came to check out we had to push really hard to get a 2pm check-out. Breakfast was fantastic, at weekends they had a kids section (basically a chocolate zone) and the adult section had a selection that I have rarely seen equalled. Service was good although we didn't eat in the hotel other than breakfast. Overall good value for money. If the extras promised at time of booking had been delivered this really would have been a 5* review.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, but needs improvements”
Reviews.Author: Dutchguy71
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Hesperia Madrid painters were busy in the lobby. No doorman was stated at the door so we had to took our own luggage to the reception. Half of the hotel was blocked because of the painters. We were very disappointed by this view. The check in was good, but the receptionist did not recognize us as a LHW member. Although we said during reservation that we want to be in a non-smoking room, the receptionist asked us if we wanted to stay in a smoking or non smoking room. This is something you do not ask for when this is mentioned explicitly in the reservation request. As the painters were working the sushi restaurant was closed. We had to eat in the Scottish bar. This is a cigar bar. So we did not want to eat there. We were sitting in the lobby waiting for our food. It took ages before the waiter came to our table. We were eating and drinking in the smell of cigars and paint. This is not a good start for your holiday. The room was good, it was very warm in the room as the air-conditioning was not on when we entered the room. The bathroom is okay, you have to shower in bath. Our room was overlooking the Paseo de la Castellana, so we had some street noise, especially as we had the window open, but this did not bother us. The first night we got 2 complimentary bottles of water, the second and third night no water was provided by the hotel and the water from the tab was with chlorine. In my opinion a 5-star hotel has to provide complimentary bottles of water for the night Breakfast was disappointing. No eggs to order. There was more than enough food, however the quality was not the best. The salmon was a bit brown on the end of the pieces. We had better breakfasts especially as the price for breakfast is not included in the room. All other days we had breakfast outside. I became ill during the stay in the hotel. The reception was very friendly and helpful. They called a doctor, they looked for a pharmacy (open on Sunday) and they helped us very good. Service is excellent. When we asked for a late check out (we want to have a check out at 5 PM) they said that this was not possible but that they could give us a checkout at 4 PM. I do not understand this. In my opinion the hotel is busy with a renovation. The hall has a minimalistic design while the rooms are real hotel rooms. Totally not minimalistic. This is a strange combination. Location is good, close to the metro. We liked the free wifi. All hotels have to offer free wifi in my opinion it was working efficiently and fast.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, very disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Little-Fruit-Bat
Reviews.Content: I tried the Hesperia to compare it against other hotels I had stayed at in Madrid and was very disappointed. They gave me a tiny room overlooking a roof, which is very short-sighted when dealing with corporate clients that, if happy with the hotel, will spend weeks there. The free wi-fi Internet connection wasn't working, I ordered room service and they brought me something different from what was on the menu. Breakfast buffet was just ok, I wasn't impressed by the quality of food either. Check-in and even more check-out were cold and without a smile, I felt like they didn't care whether you've been happy or not, nor do they ask you for your feedback. I cannot understand how this hotel can be classified as one of the "Leading Hotels of the World".

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: seajaySurrey
Reviews.Content: We had a room with no view but that is all we can fault. The bed was comfortable, robes and slippers were provided, wonderful toiletries and a well-stocked mini bar. The breakfast was fantastic - lots of choice. The hotel is minutes away from the Metro which is very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Everything a top hotel should be- a first-class hotel that treats every guests in a first-class manner.”
Reviews.Author: DougCG
Reviews.Content: The Hesperia falls into my absolute favorite category of hotels: the top-of-the line hotel that treats every guest- regardless of what they paid, what they look like upon check-in, or how long they're staying- in a top-of-the-line manner. I traveled on business and booked at a very low rate but never felt for a moment that I wasn't receiving the hotel's best possible service. Early check-in was no problem, and I was upgraded from a regular room to a junior suite without asking. Room was fantastic; comfortable and spacious, with a large sitting area and a terrific bathroom. The bed was on a slightly raised platform- a half step up from the rest of the room- but a tiny row of lights around the platform, visible only when one got up, prevented tripping and ensured that the raised bed was an endearing quirk. Service was perfect. I had one bag with me, and while I had no doubt that had I given any signal that I needed help it would have been forthcoming immediately, I was not swarmed by bellhops (a pet peeve of mine). The buffet breakfast, included in my room price, was wonderful. Free wifi worked very well. Great location, with plenty of sights within walking distance and instant subway access for those that weren't. I'd recommend the Hesperia to anyone without hesitation, and I'd especially recommend it to business travelers and budget-conscious leisure travelers looking for first-class treatment regardless of how they booked or what they paid. The Hesperia makes every guest feel welcome and is a perfect choice for Madrid visitors.

Reviews.Title: “very luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: petra66
Reviews.Content: I think between the best hotel that I visited: all comfort, chocolate, beauty case, kindless and luxe is garanted

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Hesperia is perfect”
Reviews.Author: London8910
Reviews.Content: Great location, comfortable and plenty of nearby public transport, easy for central Madrid, Bernabeu and airport but more importantly superb staff. We had a problem via our online travel agent booking but Hotel Hesperia staff sorted it out for us perfectly and we will always be grateful to DANIEL BRINON in reservations for doing this. He is a perfect example of Hesperia's attitude to guest relations ie fantastic. If you go to Madrid don't book anywhere else but the Hesperia - they look after you. Rooms, breakfast etc all great as well. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel if you like fake fire alarms!”
Reviews.Author: MutatisMutandis
Reviews.Content: This is a 5 star hotel located in the center of Madrid with very good access to the major spots to visit Madrid. Staff is kind, rooms are clean altough not very spacious and a very nice breakfast waits for you every morning. Oh, and if you like to relax a little bit more in the morning they serve breakfast till 1100h AM. Nice!! All in all could be a great hotel, but.... But unfortunately there it was: The horrendous fire alarm of the 3rd floor that buzzes 3 or 4 times every night for EVERY of the 3 nights that we were there. It would buzz (only) for about 5 to 10 seconds, but my friends I can assure you that 5 seconds of that sound around 4am can almost make your feel the sensation of what would be an heart attack experience! Despite we called reception several times to check if everything ok (on the positive side, there was no fire at all), they simply did nothing to try to solve the alarm malfunctioning during our entire stay. This is something that I consider unacceptable for any hotel and even less for a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Go There!”
Reviews.Author: organiser
Reviews.Content: We had excellent value for our money as we booked through expedia about 9 months in advance so it was very reasonable. Fantastic service from the day we booked. Friendly helpful staff,especially the guest relations officer who arranged tickets for the big match with no problem. Rooms lovely, breakfast fantastic. When the room next door decided to party until 5am and we complained , we were upgraded . My husband is learning Spanish and everyone, without exception, encouraged him to try and were very patient. Location - at first we thought a little outside of things but with the metro on the doorstep there was no problem. Once we had our bearings we realised the centre was a scenic 30 -40 mins walk, well worth it. Recommend mamma Mias Italian restauarant within 5 mins walk of the hotel as cheap but excellent food and service. Best authentic eating was at Mercado St Miguel, just past the Plaza Mayor. Tapas heaven- very busy at lunchtime. It was raining when we went to Plaza St Ana, just below Sol, but the bars and restaurants looked great and you could easily imagine sitting in the sunshine with wine and tapas, watching the world go by... we want to go back again very soon

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: handyspanner
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights and due to reviews I was expecting 5* all around. Unfortunately, that was not my experience. I use hotels a lot and I see myself as a pretty reasonable guest, who does not really want much apart from friendly/helpful staff, clean and comfortable room with somewhere you can get a reasonable meal. On the first night I arrived around 1930, and the front desk staff were very surly and unhelpful with an inappropriate attitude. I arrived in my room to find there is no coffee/tea facilities which I felt were poor for a hotel of this standing. Having dropped my bags off, as I was told in reception and from the hotel information that the restaurant opened at 2000, I went down for some food. When I got there and sat down I was told by another surly waitress that the restaurant was not open until 2100 and I would have to leave! The menu was very poor and unattractive for a hotel of this standing; maybe they left it all for the Michelin star restaurant!! Came back to my room and ordered room service to be told I would have to wait an hour! So I went to bed and dreamed of food instead. When I came to check out I wanted to check into my flight and print off my boarding card. The business area only had two PC's and one was being used by some lady updating her "facebook" so I could not get on and the other unit was broken. Went to reception to ask them if I could use their computer in the office to check in and print off the BC, however, the little “jobs worth” of the head of front desk would not let the young lady do it for me, although she more than willing to help. Over all, the room was comfortable but the staff and reception was appalling. I had the feeling that I was there to help them rather than the other way around. The hotel is expensive for what you get and again you have to pay for internet! Would not stay here again through choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excelente!”
Reviews.Author: HonkHonk
Reviews.Content: The Hesperia Madrid Hotel in is a terrific choice when visiting this fantastic city. The hotel rooms and common areas are very attractive and well maintained. The hotel is well situated in Madrid’s business area and a reasonable distance from the old town/city center. It is located on a tree-lined side street that serves as part of the Paseo de la Castellana thoroughfare. I was particularly impressed with the overall quality of the hotel, especially given my rate of 106 Euros per night. All of that said, I am not sure a 5-star rating is suitable, but I would agree to a solid 4-star rating. I arrived much earlier than check-in time, but got into my room with no problem. Check-in was fast, easy, and friendly. The room was very clean, odorless, nicely decored, and very comfortable. Most impressive was the option to choose from seven – yes, seven -- different types of pillows simply by calling guest services. The bathroom was attractive, clean, and well appointed though a bit small. Room amenities included free wireless internet, safe, ironing board, bath robes/slippers, hair dryer, and mini-bar. The bed was very comfortable. Downsides: The climate control in the room did not work and the room was hot. Fortunately, the temperature was about 9C/48F and I could open a window to cool it down. There was utterly no view whatever. The only clock in the room was on the tv, but went off when the tv was off. Someone’s fingernail clipping was in the sink. The bathroom door was glass with an etched pattern, but it was quite easy to look through the non-etched glass pattern and get a pretty full view of the bathroom. Predictably, food prices were preposterous (20 Euros for a burger, 5 for a small Coke), but if you are a weary traveler with no time to prowl around looking for food, there are few options close by. On check out, my room had been charged with several unidentified mini-bar items, though I had used nothing and touched nothing. They made good on it with no argument, though. I’m a little surprised that other reviewers raved so much about the breakfast buffet. It was included with the room cost and was okay, but sub-par in variety and quality compared to most of my other Euro hotel breakfast experiences. I certainly did not think it was bad but not great either. I don’t know how the Spanish do it, but their coffee is just the best. This is a great hotel in a convenient part of Madrid. Despite a few minor downsides, I was very pleased with it all the way around and would highly recommend it. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located for the fair, il you have a car. Good services”
Reviews.Author: emk06
Reviews.Content: A five star hotel with a five star services. Amazing breakfast. Concierge very efficient : what else? Superbe collection de rhums ambrés au bar

Reviews.Title: “Nice, polished, but failed on the all important details.”
Reviews.Author: MissMartinih
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my parter on a business trip and I here's what I can say about it. Good Points: The place hotel looks terrific, great open airy spaces and lush interior design. You can walk to the exceptionally good Madrid underground (2 min walk) and be in Tribunal (near Gran Via, Sol, etc) in 3 stops. Impressive breakfast, nothing to envy to a roman banquet. Bad Points; The room size was adequate, nothing special, a tad old-fashioned (like the hotel deco) and I found some details quite inadequate. For example, the bathrobes looked tired and very used and there was mould on the corner of the shower. Also, the bed was not comfortable at all. The mattress sunk in the middle so we didn't feel very well rested in the morning. My partner is given the choice between 3 or 4 hotels in Madrid and we have not stayed in Hesperia again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: crazy4nature
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hesperia for 3 nights during a business trip to Madrid. I chose the hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and photos/description in its website. There are several Hesperia in the city and this one is the newest addition. The hotel is modern, the lobby is functional and pleasantly decorated. My room was cozy, quiet and comfortable, though a bit small. The breakfast buffet was overpriced but more than adequate. The rooftop gym with a view of the city is great, one of the best hotel gyms. The location is ideal for business but not tourists. There are plenty of taxis at the entrance, and a metro station within a block so this is not a consideration if you are traveling for business. Overall, I really enjoyed the hotel and I will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not in the center.”
Reviews.Author: hnguye4
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and everyone was very friendly. We stayed here a few days before we headed back home. It is further away from the center so it makes it a little inconvenient but the room was very large and nice. I had read on here that we would get turn down service with Godiva chocolate but we never got any :( However, the breakfast every morning was delicious. There were so many things to choose from so there was something for both of us to enjoy. We got a very nice deal off of Travelzoo. I dont know if it would have been worth it to stay so far from the center with our short amount of time. However, I will say that it is very close to the metro and it was very easy and convenient to get back to the airport when it was time to go. It was also a nice plus to have free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel -- if you get discounted rate”
Reviews.Author: TCH1
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for airport -- arrived directly within minutes. Very close to the metro station (2 minutes?) which will get you into the old city, but for many locations you will need to transfer. We never did try the bus system but there is a regular route outside that takes you directly downtown. General location is generally lifeless but there are some decent restaurants further south, along General Martinez Campos, we walked to the heart of the Malasena district within 20 minutes. Value rating is accurate at the rate we paid via Hotline ($120USD). Prices at the hotel are five-star, for sure, but they don't press their services and food on you. Would have loved to try the 2-star Michelin restaurant in the basement but at estimated cost of 300 euros for two, had to pass. The hotel itself felt like a four star hotel at most. Good but not spectacular facilities. Decent bathroom. Staff were professional and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “They just couldn't do enough ........................”
Reviews.Author: judy_ian_9
Reviews.Content: Following an email from Travelzoo - we stayed Fri - Sun on a 40% off deal inc Breakfast - and a late (6pm checkout) On arrival at the airport we took the metro to Gregorio Maranon which is only a couple of minutes walk away - before entering the hotel we were greeted at the door by a very polite member of staff who relieved us of our luggage - the next time we saw it was in our room. The checking in member of staff was efficient, polite and friendly. There were 2 events being held in Madrid that weekend and the Tourist Information Team within the reception area couldn't have been more helpful if they tried ............. nothing was too much bother Our room was a good size and at the time of booking we were able to select a preferred pillow type ie therapeutic!!! One negative would be the lack of replacement of the shower gel and shampoo but I have no doubt that had we bothered to ask it would have been replaced daily The breakfast - buffet style was amazing and as ours was included in our 'deal' it was even more amazing!!! If ever we returned to Madrid without a doubt we would stay here

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star hotel, but good for 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: bvcbv
Reviews.Content: The service is excellent. We had contact with the reception and customer support several times and they were very helpful (for example we wanted to rent a car and almost everywhere was fully book, they have kept trying until fund one). Other than this, I think it is not a 5 star hotel, even if they advertising it as one. The most important issue was the room: small and noisy. We could not get a decent sleep in 3 nights as a child in one of the next rooms was making a lot of noise. The rooms are not sound proof at all, and you can hear crystal clear everything some else is saying on the hallway or in the rooms next to yours! When somebody else is taking a shower in the next room, you know it. You can really try hard to find another 5 star hotel without sound proof rooms. Also, the hotel does not have a swimming pool, bell boy, etc. The reception area is similar to a 3 star hotel (not even 4), and during the night they close the front door (due to the fact that there is only one person from the staff in the entire hotel), and you need to ring to get into the hotel. The breakfast is ok, but you could expect from a 5 star hotel to have an egg corner, or prepare your scrambled eggs on the spot with the ingredients you like. Bad luck, Hesperia does not have this, and the only eggs you can find are plain scrambled eggs prepared before in a big tray. I am not saying that it is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. But when you pay for 5 stars, you expect 5 stars, and Hesperia just isn't.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional..I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: gringottsgoblin
Reviews.Content: I really liked the Hesperia. It is easy to get to from the airport (20 mins)being really close to a metro stop and easy to get into the city (10 mins) via the same metro stop. It is in a nice location on a leafy boulevard. The service is first class, The room while not decorated to my taste was really clean and well appointed and quite spacious with an excellent bathroom. The public areas are nice and varied, and it is possible to have a nice quite drink and a cosy environment. The staff were most accomodating without being in your face. Breakfast was excellent and in my case inclusive. Then there was the price which was for a single in a double room incl breakfast and this only came to €93 ( in high season ,mid week in a major city). I will most definitely be back and next time with more people. Well done Hotel Hesperia: Madrid you hit the target bang on.

Reviews.Title: “right choice”
Reviews.Author: nobakwas
Reviews.Content: i travel a fair bit and stay in good hotels all over the world and it was quite a pleasure to be here for four nights from 29th of july. my wife and i arrived from paris with friends on the first leg of our visit to spain and were very glad to have chosen this hotel. everything that we experienced - food (also has a michelin rated restaurant), rooms, amenties, etc was right. the attention received from the front office, room service, concierge, bell desk (pleasing and informative female porter!), etc will be indelible in our memory. i can not imagine visiting madrid again and staying elsewhere...

Reviews.Title: “eh, so so”
Reviews.Author: globetrottermom
Reviews.Content: I just spent two nights at the Hesperia Madrid; I had two rooms for my children and myself. Because I had such an attractive rate for the rooms owing to an online offer, it feels almost wrong to complain about anything, but I want to paint a clear picture of what the hotel is and isn't for those considering it. Firstly, the service is fantastic. We arrived several hours in advance of our check in and they happily gave us one of our rooms which was ready to be occupied. Additionally, they cheerfully accommodated our flight schedule and allowed for a late check out. The staff at the reception, in the lobby and at the door was without exception attentive, informative an genuinely friendly. The lobby is pleasant if not a little dated in it's design concepts. At the rear of the reception area there is a very inviting patio dining area which I sadly skipped as it seemed better suited to business people than the children I was traveling with. The two rooms I had were slightly different from one another. They were both oriented toward the interior (i.e, not the street) which meant they were slightly dark yet quiet which I assumed (correctly) would make for better sleep than a sunny room facing Castellana. One room was fairly small in size and had two twin beds; this was a very cramped space and the darker and sadder of the two rooms. The second room had an expansive bedroom area with a queen bed. While it faced a wall in the courtyard, the bathroom window looked out on to an open space and subsequently had plenty of natural light. So be ready because as I learned, the rooms in the same category can vary dramatically in terms of size and light. Because I was both tired and humbled by my insane online rate, I didn't try to jockey for a better room. I just let it be, which I think is basically all you can do in Spain most of the time. It is what it is. The rooms were comfortable, but not perfect. If you are someone who is amused by good design, the look of these rooms will not grab you. The interior is "generic hotel" with it's cranberry, dark wood and brass. Banal but comfortable. The one super negative of the interiors concerned the desk chair in my larger room had a rather unfortunate stain on the seat. Nothing takes a girl out of basking in luxury like seeing yucky stains. The good news is that the bathrooms were very nice in both rooms with natural stone, a large bathtub and nice towels and robes. In fact, the bathroom was the only component of the room that met the standards of a 5 star hotel that is part of the Leading Hotels of the World network. The only trouble in this area is the slight suggestion of mold growing on the corners of the tub where tile meets porcelain. That made for a less than perfect bath experience. In the final analysis, I think this is a fantastic hotel to stay in if you are able to procure a great rate. I might not set out to book this hotel as a destination because there are probably other hotels in Madrid in this category that would provide a more luxurious stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice but not central”
Reviews.Author: BenBagBag
Reviews.Content: Off the central groove but great value and 100 metres from the metro, which will take you anywhere. We were upgraded on arrival, without asking. Good 5* room. Did not eat breakfast in hotel (it seemed expensive). Excellent, prompt room service. Great staff. Great shops and huge department store within walking distance (have a good value breakfast at the restaurant in the department store, El Corte Ingles). Top restaurant, one of the best in Spain, right next to the hotel. Do the hop-on-hop-off bus (which runs to late at night in summer and then buy a museum pass for the three top museums (don't fall for expensive cards or tours). Enjoyed Spain but if you are vegetarian you need to do some research first, Madrid is cured ham territory.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but very poor service in restaurant”
Reviews.Author: sussexART
Reviews.Content: I got a very good deal for this hotel through the late rooms web site - paying an average of about 75 euros each night for 3 nights. The room was comfortable and spacious, although quite dark as the windows overlooked a courtyard. The air conditioning was not working in the room that I was first allocated, so after many calls to reception they moved me to another room. One night I decided to try the restaurant. I asked if the menu del dia still applied in the evening and was told yes. However it turned out that it didn't and I ended up having few tapas at an extortionate cost. The service in the restaurant was abysmal, but apart from that service was basically OK, although I didn't find the staff nearly as helpful as most of the other reviewers.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good service and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: regazzamilano
