Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a great location and is easy to find. the staff is very nice--- we arrived very early in the morning and we realized we were too early to check in, but they let us change our clothes in a bathroom with a shower and held our bags for no extra change. when we returned to check in they had upgraded us since we had to wait to check in. very nice. the hotel is beautiful and the staff was really nice!

Reviews.Title: “Good. Nice gym. Free wireless.”
Reviews.Author: KristaInLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after snagging a room on Hotwire at $114 USD or 84 euros. The hotel was perfectly located for my office. The lobby is really nice-looking. (I didn't find it cheap like a previous reviewer.) To use the lift, you have to use your roomkey, which is a nice safety measure. The rooms are a bit 1990. Red, dark wood, gold. That being said, they were perfectly clean and acceptable. (I also did not find the bedding worn as a previous reviewer did.) The two clinchers for me where the nice gym (2 treadmills, 4 bikes, 2 cross trainers, a number of weight machines, and free weights) on the roof of the hotel, with views across Madrid, as well as the free wireless. (Remember to ask for your code at the front desk.) I ordered room service one morning and it was great. Bacon and eggs were very nicely turned out. So...I got this hotel for the right price. I've stayed at better places, but also for more money! So I thought that my Hotwire deal made this a good find.

Reviews.Title: “Not to LHW standard, hardly a 5*”
Reviews.Author: PortoTraveller
Reviews.Content: The Hesperia Madrid was a huge disappointment. I was lucky enough to book 3 nights there for 100 euros per night, breakfast not included, and was very much looking forward to my stay there. I actually think I've paid the deserved price for a banal business property. The minimalist decor in the lobby looked somewhat cheap, the open plan restaurant was more Novotel than LHW, the overall first impression was 4 star business hotel with almost no distinct identity. The rooms are even worse. Very out of fashion decor, in a sort of 80's USA corporate luxury way, with lots of fake gold, carved wood and heavy textiles, a bit worn off and in need of maintenance, and completely out of touch with the modern, though banal, mid 90's building and its lobby's attempt at an oriental look. We had problems with the air conditioning, which made a very disturbing noise every now and then for the whole night. The linens were a bit worn off and the mattress was not very firm. The room faced an inner courtyard and had almost no natural light. It felt rather confined. The bathroom was very old fashioned, with lots of brass railings, brown and beije marble with a few cracks here and and needing some heavy scrubbing, tiny bathtub, no bidet, an annoying glass door, and a cracked window. It all looked rather dated and lacking in maintenance. Service was fine though, the staff was friendly and took our comments with attention and concern. The valet parking worked like a charm (22 euros per day). At 27 euros we didn't try the breakfast. The biggest plus was the free wireless internet. Madrid has lots of Hotels to choose from, and allthough the rate was really good, I wouldn't return for the same price (100 euros) and would rather pay an additional 30-50 euros to stay in another property.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stevemarg01
Reviews.Content: stayed 2 nights Oct 08. Have nothing but praise for this hotel. staff fantastic, rooms clean and well equipped. Thought the drinks were reasonably priced and the food although a little strange was good. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: rnaman
Reviews.Content: I've recently stayed for 3 nights at the Hesperia Madrid. It was a great surprise the excellent service in all aspects. The staff is very attentive, the rooms are very confortable and well appointed. The bathrooms are in marble and the amenities are Bvlgari. They provide free wi-fi internet access to all guests. The only negative point is the location. If you are going on business, ok. But if yu are going for sightseeing, be aware that you'll end up using a lot of taxi or subway, because almost all major attractions aren't close by.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent design, perfect service”
Reviews.Author: mcharbonnel
Reviews.Content: Clean, beautiful, quiet, ... this hotel is one of the best I've ever visited. I enjoyed the very professional attitude of the concierge, and the wonderful "smoking lounge" were I had the chance to smoke a very hard-to-find cigar with an excellent cognac. Very nice room, but with poor view. Quite good location in Madrid (but not exactly in the historical center). This is a Leading Hotel of the World, and it definitely belongs to this category.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Oxondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for a business trip and conference. Just 15 mins from the airport on the clean and pleasant metro for Euro 2.60 (colleague in a taxi took an hour in traffic for Euro 16!) Hotel is 30 seconds from the metro station, but is off centre (near the financial district) and a bit of a trek for shopping or tourism. Plenty of service in the lobby, but only one person on the desk in the evening. A room looking out onto a seven storey concrete shaft - but the alternative would have been much noisier, I suspect, facing onto a major traffic artery. Well appointed, clean and modern standard room on the 5th floor. Really comfortable bed. Good temperature control. Excellent bathroom and shower with no conceivable item not provided. Good value and pretty good quality breakfast in room. Free wifi (need code from front desk) which works even after you've checked out. Room safe big enough for a laptop. Business centre a bit dozy, but offers a useful boarding pass printing service.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: American_in_Italy
Reviews.Content: Had a 4 night stay with Hesperia Madrid. Overall a good experience, despite a few minues. Please see below what I think is a balanced a fair review: The positives: - Guest services desk completely organized the AVE high speed train tickets from madrid to seville, including getting the paper tickets delivered. - Room had fresh fruit and snacks daily - Excellent breakfast (unusual for Madrid I'm told) and made to order things like Mango puree or waffels included in buffet price - 30 sec walk to the Metro station - Weight and fitness room has some good offerings - Choices of pillows nice - Extremely quiet. I hardly saw anyone there. Maid service was polite. - Staff very helpful at getting you cabs and making sure the driver knew where you wanted to go. The negatives: - First time I called guest services to book a flamenco show, I was told I should call back and ask the person again at the desk tomorrow, as the show is closed sundays (why couldn't the person I just explained everything to write a note for their colleague on Sunday?) - the bathroom was poorly light, with 4 recessed lights, (none over toliet and bath. On several occassions there was some kind of a short, and 3 of the 4 lights went out. The front desk said someone would fix it (and did but only temporarily) - The Guest services told us that the train tickets to Toledo could be picked up on the spot at the station. however when we got there we experienced a Mob of people, and were told to get in a que where you take a number..... to make a long story short we missed the train. No one seems to understand how this train system works for the short serve trains. recommend asking the Guest services people to procure these tickets for you as well. - I was under the impression the hotel had a spa.... but in fact they do not. (I happen to call from my cell phone while I was out one day, and asked the front desk if I could make a spa appt and was told "we don-t have a spa...." What they do have in the fitness room is a bare minimum list of spa services, which I guess they outsource from another place. In any case it is not advertised v much (e.g. not even a spa menu in the room.) so in short, overall a good experience - as I figure the negatives (train incident and lighting) were probably flukes. Probably the biggest disapointment for me was not having an on site spa. I would probably stay closer to downtown if I were to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Hesperia”
Reviews.Author: GAPLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked for our anniversary. From the moment we stepped into the hotel it was luxurious and modern. The staff were very friendly and went out of their way to please us. We were escourted to our room which was a fair size. A platter of fresh fruit and little cakes awaited us - it wasn't a big bowl but enough for two. The towels and bathrobes were very soft, the hairdryer was a proper size and worked well. The toiletries were replaced everyday. There were even complimentary comb, toothbrush, shaver etc. Bvlgari products an extra bonus. We fillled out our pillow menu and submitted it to reception before we went our. When we returned at night they turned down the beds and left Godiva chocolates. There was also half a bottle of Moet and Strawberries in the room because of our anniversary. We had a lovely Lobster Paella in the hotel restaurant - which was very good €29 per person. Cocktails were good at the bar €12 - 15. Prices are a bit steep but it is 5star! The breakfast was amazing and you could help yourself to the Moet at the juice section of the restaurant. Included in the breakfast was a menu which you could order as many items or nothing at all. The reason I booked this hotel was because it was away from the touristy areas of the city and Serrano was very very close - designer shops amazing. The metro is very efficient we used it all the time - no cabs at all. It was handy from the airport too with one change and it was merely 1 minute walk from the hotel. Overall this is a really wonderful hotel the only fault I have is that the TV should have been more centrally located and modernised but I will definitely go back for the luxury and walking distance to Serrano. If you book this hotel try and get a deal which includes breakfast we paid £94 included breakfast for 2 per night other wise you end up paying €27 Euros. Amazing place definity will go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with a few drawbacks - great location”
Reviews.Author: limxela
Reviews.Content: A decent hotel in one of the nicest neighborhoods of Madrid - Barrio Salamanca. A 9-story building with 171 rooms, good quality gym and free WiFi. Location is great, 5 minutes walk from Calle Serrano,and from el Corte Ingles if you need to buy anything, and a cab ride to anywhere in the city is 5-7 euro. Rooms are decent, anthought overheated. Service okay. Room cleaning and turndown services are good. Hotel's lobby restaurant (Manzana) is very decent for breakfast, but beware of the price - 27 Euro per person. The only dinner I had to have there was horrific: plates were not clean, silerware warn and not great, food was not fresh - let alone good. There are at least 5-6 decent restaurants close by, so stay away from Manzana. Restaurant Santeloni is located in the same building. This is currently considered the best restaurant in Madrid. Reservations are made about a month in advance, +34-92-210-8840.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: elmo1980
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 2 nights there to spend our new years celebration in madrid. The hotel located in a good ,central but quite location compare to gran via and sol.Only 10 mins walk to the shopping center serrano street. 1 mins walk to the metro. The staffs were friendly and helpful, they even did a booking for us at a great seafood restaurant as we didnt know where to go for dinner.only that i think they do need to regenerate the tv as its still from the old technology.We were also very satisfied with the buffet breakfast. Will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: blackpushkin
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with modern decor. The location is perfect. Its in the more quiter neighbourhood of madrid but with easy access to the rest of the city and airport. Metro is 50m from the hotel. attentive and helpful staff. bulgari amenities and fresh fruit on arrival with godiva chocolates with turn down service gave it a nice and wonderful touch. only complaint is that they had messed up my bill. would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely decor, shame about the a/c”
Reviews.Author: Alexia
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, attentive staff, excellent breakfast (I can´t imagine what a previous reviewer was talking about). Room was not huge and faced the back so as a previous reviewer said request front facing if that bothers you. However, the main and major fault it had was that the air-conditioning wasn´t working and when we mentioned it we were told that the hotel doesn´t switch it on till later in the year. It made our night very uncomfortable and with the room facing a rear courtyard couldn´t get a breeze either. Would I stay there again? Not if the a/c wasn´t working, otherwise yes.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, friendly staff, terrible breakfest”
Reviews.Author: Bodo1182
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and me stayed at the Hesperia in September 2005. Pluses: -The hotel staff was very friendly and helpfull, eventhough they didnt speak english perfectly (which i expect when staying at a 5*-Leading Hotel of the World) -Junior Suites were very big and nicely decorated -House Keeping did a good job keeping the rooms clean Minuses: -The breakfest which was included in our room price (EUR 300 p. night) was just terrible. The warm stuff was mainly cold. The sausages were burned and the eggs looked greenish. The breakfest buffet did have good freshly squeezed juices. But the worst thing on sunday. Merely every 5* I ever stayed in had a nice Sunday brunch. Not the Hesperia. They have the same crappy breakfest as the rest of the week. Overall if you stay at this hotel and book a rate with no breakfest incl. you will have a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: ansalm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Madrid to celebrate my birthday and we chose this hotel because we wanted a nicer hotel than what we could get for the same price in the center, and it turned out to be a very nice stay. It is located in a more residential/business area of madrid, but there are still very nice restaurants not far from the hotel where we could go for breakfast (EUR 25 pp at the buffet was a bit steep) or out at night since its located in one of the nicest residential neighborhoods. The fact that is was a bit far from the center was not a problem at all, there is a bus stop right in front of the hotel which takes you directly to the center (15 min direct ride to the Puerta del Sol), and a metro stop half a block away where you can easily get to the airport (changing once). And although the room we got was a bit small (and had an inside view) there were very nice amenities that made up for it: fruit basket when you arrive (only the first day), great bathroom and toiletries, the most luscious bathrobe, and even a pillow menu! The restaurants at the hotel (2) are good but a bit expensive, and there is one that has 1 michelin star. went to the other one and had the best paella-type thing ever!! all in all, very nice hotel a bit far from tourist attractions but very easy to get from here to any place and well worth it for the price we got!

Reviews.Title: “A 5 star with to much noise during the night”
Reviews.Author: ordep
Reviews.Content: When I arrived they had the garage full. They gave me the location of a garage nearby but after several attempts I returned to the reception and they didnt care much... The room was located near a stair used by people strange to the hotel and the problem with wekends in Madrid is that the famous "movida" stop your from sleeping. I can understand that in a 2 or 3 star hotel but not in a 5 star. The room was overheated, and I couldnt find the button to swich off... In the morning the breakfast was OK but there was a traffic jam at the lobby to pay the bill and go away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: goreliky
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy, but perfectly nice. The room was adequate size, the bath was spacious and clean. The shutters and windows provided a very quiet nights sleep. Excellent location, minutes from Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor and Palacio Real, just off the Grand Via. When we had a problem with the TV, they replaced it within minutes, when asked for extra pillows, they brought them up that night, no complains about the service. Front desk staff spoke sufficient english as our spanish was nonexistent and we could not ask for more at this price (averaged about 75eur/ night).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Not best location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this hotel very much. Room was great given the rate (205 Euros booked through American Express Platinum Travel Service). HOwever, the air conditioning leaves something to be desired, especially on a hot July afternoon with a room facing the sun. Breakfast was nice and the design of the hotel is pretty good looking. Wireless internet was free in the room too! Only downside - I dont think this was the most centrally located hotel. Kind of a challenge in terms of subways too.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, some details need improvement”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hesperia for three nights. Room was very comfortable. Service was ok but they charged me for early arrival 1/2 a day (never happened before at any other hotel.)This is not good since most flights from America arrive early in the morning. (I imagine they would not discount 1/2 a day if I checked out early) Free wireless internet. Very clean and neat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but some probelms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from the Hesperia I was disappointed with many aspects of my stay. The hotel itself is very nice and the location is good. Rooms can be had from about 160 Euro, try to get a room not facing the back. Considering this hotel is part of the prestige Leading Hotels of the World group, many aspects of my stay were surprising. Rooms are quite noise, thin walls let you know exactly what is going on in neighboring rooms as well as above and below you. The promised newspaper in the morning did not arrive on either of my two mornings. One night they forgot the turn down service and there were lots of other little service problems which added up to an overall less than satisfying stay. Food in the main restaurant was OK, not great but front desk and front door service was good. They also reacted very positively to the negative feedback I shared with them. Having read that the hotel picks their employees based on acting ability and other unconventional hiring techniques, they might want to review this practice... Net, net, next time I will stay elsewhere although I might have just been at the Hesperia on two bad days.

Reviews.Title: “5-Star for European Standards”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations. Stayed on two seperate ocassions for a total of 8 nights. For business, it is ideally located in the Paseo de las Castellana. If you are travelling for tourism, you are not too far either, since Madrid's center is ver compact. This is one of the safest districts to stay in Madrid, as the Gran Via and Plaza de Espana areas are plagued with pick-pocketers and prostitution. Rooms are brand-spanking new and funcitonal, although like in most Madrid hotels, don't come here looking for a view, since most rooms face a courtyard that is not much to speak about. Bulgari toiletries provided, and the service is very good (room service, valets, housekeeping, concierge), as the hotel is one of the Leading Hotels of the World group, an association which has rigorous standards as far as service. The lobby is impressive for a Madrid hotel, yet the traffic flow in and out of the hotel is like that of a boutique hotel. Restaurant is overpriced and not great, but there are plenty of good restaurants and cafes in the area. I would venture to say that this is the best hotel in Madrid and probably will be for a couple of years.
